alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 3:58PM EDT until August 12 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Harrison County in east central Ohio... Southwestern Carroll County in east central Ohio... Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 357 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Walnut Creek, or 8 miles east of Millersburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Baltic, Midvale, Bowerston, Barnhill, Dellroy, Sherrodsville, Roswell, Parral, Stone Creek, Leesville, Tippecanoe, and Stillwater. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 71 and 89. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
